intro: Biscutella valentina var. variegata, commonly known as the variegated biscutella, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers in early spring. Its variegated foliage, characterized by white and green patterns, makes it an ornamental plant in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
